p: An acute pre-renal failure was reported in several cases, of which one-third of the affected patients with previous kidney disease ( Robin et al., 2008). The condition is usually controlled by increasing the patient’s blood volume by intravenous hydration, and the reported cases seem to have responded well to this therapeutic approach. There’s only one case of a nephritic syndrome that emerged during an outbreak of CHIKV in Delhi with full recovery ( Lemant et al., 2008).
